data.title: Hayley Erin
data.meta_description: Hayley Erin is an American actress who is known for her portrayal of Kiki Jerome on the ABC soap opera General Hospital, for which she won a Daytime Emmy Award. data.text:
Hayley Erin is an American actress who is known for her portrayal of Kiki Jerome on the ABC soap opera General Hospital, for which she won a Daytime Emmy Award.

Career[]

Erin's first acting role was in 2004 when she guest starred on an episode of Malcolm in the Middle. She was also seen on the FOX sketch show MADtv in two sketches—Celebrity Quarters and a fake movie trailer for It's A Small World as Dakota Fanning.

She also made an appearance in the Nickelodeon original series, True Jackson VP and in the Disney original series, Austin and Ally.

She is known for playing the teenage Abby Carlton on The Young and the Restless (2008–10). She returned to The Young and the Restless in a new role as Claire Grace, a new employee for Newman Media.

In January 2015, it was announced that Erin had been hired to portray the role of Kiki Jerome on General Hospital, replacing original actress Kristen Alderson in the role. She made her debut on February 26, 2015.[1][2]

In 2019, Erin played Taylor Hotchkiss, one of the main characters in the Freeform series Pretty Little Liars: The Perfectionists. Erin made her feature film debut opposite Sonya Walger in the 2023 horror-thriller film New Life. In September 2023, it was announced Erin would return to The Young and the Restless in the role of Claire Grace. [3]

Personal life[]

On July 11, 2017, Erin announced via Instagram that she is engaged to boyfriend since May 2014, model Logan Luedtke.[4][5][6] They got engaged in Kawela Bay, Hawaii.[7][8] The engagement later ended.

In 2020, Erin announced her marriage to Adam Fergus.[9] On August 9 & 10, Fergus and Erin welcomed twin daughters, Juno and Maude.[10]
